page.title: 10ADLINGTON HALL
page.content: Adlington Hall is an historic home.It has belonged to the Legh family for nearly 600 years.The present owner, Mr. Charles Legh, was interviewed by two of our pupils{Lucy {Oliver and Claire Dudley}aged eleven. At present the hall has four main parts which were built between 1450 and 1757. The oldest part is the Great Hall where some woodrot has recently been found behind the fireplace. Its most unusual feature is two pillars supporting the organ loft which were carved from living oak trees complete with roots. Visitors may look round the hall on the afternoons of Sunday, Wednesday, and Saturday. Admission costs Â£1.40 for adults and 70p for children. The hall opens from Easter to the end of September. Seven people work at the hall and its gardens.
